labels.analysis: The MCP Server acts as a bridge between Twilio's communication APIs and AI assistants or tools that follow the Model Context Protocol. Its core functionality revolves around enabling seamless integration of Twilio's services (such as SMS, voice, and other communication tools) into AI workflows. The server simplifies access to Twilio's capabilities by providing a standardized interface, allowing AI tools to leverage communication services without dealing with low-level API complexity.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen because the server's primary purpose is to facilitate API integration, acting as a middleware between AI systems and Twilio's services. Communication is the key focus, as Twilio specializes in messaging, voice, and other communication tools. No custom label is necessary, as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Twilio API MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @blockehh/mcp_twilio_build
server_info_crawled.overview: Expose Twilio's APIs to AI assistants and tools supporting the Model Context Protocol. Enable seamless integration of Twilio's communication capabilities into AI workflows. Simplify access to Twilio services through a standardized protocol interface.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@blockehh/mcp_twilio_build/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: TWILIO_API_KEY
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your Twilio API Key starting with 'SK'. Create one in Twilio Console > Account > API Keys & Tokens.

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: TWILIO_API_SECRET
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your Twilio API Secret (paired with the API Key above)
